title: Ticket #2204: Declare test a failure if "non-printable" characters found in log.
description: There is already logic in the test suite to declare a test failed if "ERROR" appears in the logs. There should be similar logic to declare a test failed if any "non-printable" characters appear in the logs. Such characters almost universally indicate corruption of some sort and thus a bug. Proposed definition of "non-printable": c<8 || c> 127
creator: adesmet
